reviewText: Received a red "Mike" train and coal tender.  Never heard of that one, but it seems to be of good quality, made of wood and plastic.  My son likes it.The video is one of the older ones w/ Ringo Starr.  The production quality isn't as good as the more recent Thomas videos and Ringo is not one of the better narrators.  He doesn't seem to have the warmth or the ability to keep the kids attention as well as others.  It sounds like he is just reading a book out loud.  Overrall, w/ the train, this is a decent value, but not great.

Title: N/A

reviewText: This is Thomas' second video and it is one of the best ones. It introduced Bertie and Terrance and it also introduced James a little more than they did in Vol.1, in fact, the first three episodes are about James. Thats good news if your a James fan like me. The last four episodes are all about Thomas. Most of them are great stories to. The story stops are:James Learns A Lesson 5/5:When James bangs his coaches to much since he is mad because he thinks he should be the most important engine because of his bright red paint, his coach coach must be mended with, of all things, a passengers bootlace.Foolish Freight Cars 5/5:Sir Topham Hatt finally lets James come out of the shed after his incident with his coaches. He must pull some freight cars and the freight cars say that James will not be able to pull them up Gordon's hill. Determined not to let them win, James gives it all he's got-with surprising results.A Proud Day For James 5/5:Gordon brags that he is the only engine strong enough to pull the express. But when he is unable to do it one day, James will have to do it.Thomas and the Conductor 4/5:When Thomas is in a hurry to get his passengers to the station, he accidentally leaves his conductor behind. This will cause Thomas to be even later.Thomas Goes Fishing 4.5/5:Thomas has always wanted to go fishing but all the other engines say,"Engines don't go fishing." One day when Thomas is thirsty and the water tank is out of order, he'll have to get water out of the river. But when Thomas starts feeling weird and his driver looks in to his tank, he'll be surprised at what he finds.Terence the Tractor 5/5:Thomas makes fun of Terence and says he has ugly gray wheels, but who will come and rescue Thomas when he gets stuck in a snow drift.Thomas and Bertie's Great Race 4.5/5:Thomas meets Bertie and challenges him to a race. At first Thomas thinks he does'nt have a chance against him, but with a little encouragement from Annie and Clarabel, Thomas just might be able to catch up to Bertie and win the race after all.Again, awesome Thomas video. I liked the first two Volumes because they didn't have Percy in them and once Percy came, it became all about him. If you want to buy a Thomas video, treat yourself to this one, it's better than some of those other ones like Spills & Chills.

reviewText: Well of course all of Thomas' Season 1 episodes are the best! Especially James Learns a lesson! Now that they discountinued almost all the of classic Thomas and Friends Videos it looks like that we will be getting them again on DVD!! Even though I already have these episodes on VHS and already on the "Thomas The Early Years" DVD (which is the british version of them) i'm going to get it anyway becasue it will be much more clear and digital then the VHS. I Can't Wait until June 14!!!!

reviewText: Thomas would not be the same without this tape. It showed James as one of the engines and it showed him learning to be a really useful engine. In many other tapes it shows James though smaller than Gordon and Henry as a big engine. He helps Gordon and Henry when they make a point. James is also one of the most popular engines. It also shows the Great Race between Thomas and Bertie. That was one of the most well known events in Thomas history. Their race has been mentioned many times. This is a really good tape. The episodes are James Learns a Lesson, Foolish Freight Cars, A Proud Day for James, Thomas and the Conductor, Thomas goes Fishing, Terence the Tractor, and Thomas and Bertie's Great Race.

reviewText: The second, I believe, of American Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends videos. Featuring 7 season 1 episodes narrated by the show's first narrator: Ringo Starr, it is truely wonderful.  The episodes are classics, well written, based on the stories by the Rev. W. Awdry who created the books the show originally was based on. The music is well done, and it has that 80's synthesizer sound to it. The scenery is well done too.  James Learns a Lesson, A Proud Day for James, and Thomas Goes Fishing are fantastic episodes. My copy is very old, and has the original cover art, and I can assure you I am looking forward to buying a replacement! Treat your children, or even yourself to a true classic and buy this instead of rubbish like Spills & Chills. Pity it is only on VHS.
summary: A True Thomas the Tank Engine Classic!

reviewText: So far all of the videos of Thomas the Train have been very entertaining for my 2 year old grandson. He knows all of the trains names and enjoys the movie action.  He is especially fond of James and Percy so this movie was really a great one for him to watch.I appreciate the fact that there are several stories in one video so he can watch for 10 or 15 minutes and we can pause until a later time after nap or play time.
